name: dioxane production | dioxane | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7721/documentation

This data represents the production of 1 kg of pure 1,4-dioxane from diethylene glycol. For this data, the production of 1,4-dioxane is via the dehydration and ring closure of diethylene glycol.  The raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation.  Energy consumption is modelled with literature data. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of diethylene glycol at the factory gate.

This activity ends with 1 kg of 1,4-dioxane, 100% at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: 1,4-Dioxane is manufactured commercially by the dehydration and ring closure of diethylene glycol. Concentrated sulfuric acid (ca. 5 %) is used as a catalyst. Operating conditions vary; temperatures  range from 130 to 200 °C and pressures range from a slight pressure to a partial vacuum (25 –110 kPa). A favorable temperature  is reported to be 160 °C. The process is continuous, with 1,4-dioxane vaporized from the reaction vessel. The vapors are passed  through an acid trap and two distillation columns to remove water and to purify the product. Yields of ca. 90 % are possible.  2-Methyl-1,3-dioxolane, acetaldehyde, crotonaldehyde, and polyglycol are unwanted byproducts.;References:;Surprenant, K.: Dioxane.  In: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, 2004 Electronic Release (ed. Fiedler E., Grossmann G., Kersebohm D., Weiss G. and Witte C.). 7th Electronic Release Edition. Wiley InterScience, New York, Online-Version under: http://www.mrw.interscience.wiley.com/ueic/articles/a01_045/

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
1,4-Dioxane is a strong solvent that is capable of dissolving most organic compounds, water in all proportions and many inorganic compounds. At ambient temperature, 1,4-dioxane is a clear liquid with an ether-like odor. Its relative stability is similar to other aliphatic ethers, and it forms peroxides if upon exposure to air. 

The largest single use of 1,4-dioxane is the stabilization of 1,1,1-trichloroethane against chemical attack by aluminum. The aluminum oxide film prevents the metal from reacting with 1,1,1- trichloroethane until the film is disturbed. When the bare metal contacts 1,1,1 trichloroethane, chlorine is extracted from the solvent to form AlCl3, which causes dehydrohalogenation of 1,1,1- trichloroethane to produce HCl and vinylidene chlorid (CH2 = CCl2). Dioxane is the foremost inhibitor of these reactions. An insoluble 1,4-dioxane-aluminum chloride complex is formed, which deactivates the catalyst and seals any openings in the Al2O3 film.

Dioxane is used as a solvent in the formulation of inks, coatings, and adhesives, and as solvent for extracting animal and vegetable oils. As a chemical intermediate, 1,4 dioxane reaction products are useful as insecticides, herbicides, plasticizers, and monomers. The oxonium complexes of 1,4-dioxane with salts, mineral acids, halogens, and sulfur trioxide are used as catalysts and as reagents for anhydrous acid reactions, brominations, and sulfonations. In the laboratory, 1,4-dioxane is useful as a cryoscopic solvent for molecular mass determinations and as a stable reaction medium for diverse reactions. Historically, 1,4-dioxane is reported to be valuable in polymer manufacture and as a solvent for natural and synthetic resins, including cellulose derivatives, polyvinyl acetal resins, acrylonitrile - methyl vinyl pyridine copolymers, and others.

flow.name: dioxane
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
Calculation.  This data was calculated from the amount of diethylene glycol in the treated waste water assuming a carbon conversion of 96% for COD and the worst case scenario: TOC=DOC. 

It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorized as emanating in a high population density area. The emissions into water are assumed to be emitted into rivers.

Estimation.  The air emissions occurring from the purge vent, the distillation vent and fugitive emission sources were estimated to 1 % of the raw material input. 

The carbon contained in the removed diethylene glycol was accounted as CO2 emissions to air.

It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorized as emanating in a high population density area.

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
Estimation.  The remaining amount of unreacted diethylene glycol (9% of the input) was assumed to leave the production process with the waste water.

Further it was assumed that this waste water is treated in an internal waste water plant. The removal efficiency for diethylene glycol was assumed with 90%. 

It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorized as emanating in a high population density area. The emissions into water are assumed to be emitted into rivers.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation.  Infrastructure is estimated based on the dataset "chemical plant, organics". This dataset assumes a built area of about 4.2 ha, an average output of 50'000 t/a, and plant life of fifty years. The estimated value is 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
